ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great course to both be exposed to experimental techniques in social science and also to "get your feet wet" by actually conducting an experiment
Yes, even with its easiness, Prof. Gerber still provide much relevant insight.

As currently structured, not a whole lot that graduate students with some advanced training in quantitative methods will learn, though reading some interesting experiments and having to run one yourself can be helpful for those with less hands-on experience doing their own experiments.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I intend to continue to conduct social scientific and public policy experiments going forward

Mostly, the course was useful in that it gave me the opportunity to design and run an experiment, which I hadn't done before. It was also sometimes useful to read innovative experiments to use as examples fo possible future research. Didn't take away much knowledge on experimental methods that I hadn't had before, though.
